question: Given that sin (5x - 28)<sup>o</sup>= cos (3x - 50)<sup>o</sup>,0 < x < 90<sup>o</sup>, find the value of x
explanation:
Sin (5x – 28)o= cos (3x - 50)o
Since by the trigonometry relation
Sin(5x – 28)o= cos[90 – (5x – 28)]o
Hence cos(3x – 50)o= cos[90 – (5x – 28)]o
3x – 50 = 90 - (5x-28)
3x – 50 = 90 – 5x + 28
3x + 5x = 90 + 28 + 50
8x = 168
\(x = \frac{168}{8}=21^{\circ}\)
